intro: Lecanthus peduncularis, commonly known as the slender lecanthus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stem and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are simple, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. Lecanthus peduncularis is typically found in open woodland and savanna habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
